simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Initialize the tables that the OS API uses to keep track of information about objects

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Initialize the tables that the OS API uses to keep track of information about objects

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Indicates that the OSAL application should exit and return control to the OS This is intended for e.g. scripted unit testing where the test needs to end without user intervention. This function does not return

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: This exits the entire process including tasks that have been created. It does not return. Production embedded code typically would not ever call this.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: OS_DeleteAllObjects() provides a means to clean up all resources allocated by this instance of OSAL. It would typically be used during an orderly shutdown but may also be helpful for testing purposes.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

briefdescription.para: OS-specific background thread implementation - waits forever for events to occur.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This should be called from the BSP main routine / initial thread after all other board / application initialization has taken place and all other tasks are running.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: OS_ApplicationShutdown() provides a means for a user-created thread to request the orderly shutdown of the whole system, such as part of a user-commanded reset command. This is preferred over e.g. ApplicationExit() which exits immediately and does not provide for any means to clean up first.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32 *task_id, const char *task_name, osal_task_entry function_pointer, uint32 *stack_pointer, uint32 stack_size, uint32 priority, uint32 flags)
memberdef.name: OS_TaskCreate

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Creates a task and starts running it.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: task_id is passed back to the user as the ID. stack_pointer is usually null. the flags parameter is unused.

parameterdescription.para: task_id uint32 Pointer to task ID number

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if any of the necessary pointers are NULL
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if the name of the task is too long to be copied
OS_ERR_INVALID_PRIORITY if the priority is bad
OS_ERR_NO_FREE_IDS if there can be no more tasks created
OS_ERR_NAME_TAKEN if the name specified is already used by a task

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Deletes the specified Task and removes it from the OS_task_table.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the ID given to it is invalid

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Exits the calling task and removes it from the OS_task_table.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Delay a task for specified amount of milliseconds

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Sets the given task to a new priority

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the ID given to it is invalid
OS_ERR_INVALID_PRIORITY if the priority is greater than the max allowed

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Registers the calling task id with the task by adding the var to the tcb It searches the OS_task_table to find the task_id corresponding to the tcb_id

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the ID given to it is invalid

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function returns the #defined task id of the calling task

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: The OS_task_key is initialized by the task switch if AND ONLY IF the OS_task_key has been registered via OS_TaskRegister(..). If this is not called prior to this call, the value will be old and wrong.
of calling task

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Sets the given task to a new priority

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if th ename to found is too long to begin with
OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND if the name wasn't found in the table

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function will pass back a pointer to structure that contains all of the relevant info (creator, stack size, priority, name) about the specified task.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the ID passed to it is invalid

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Installs a handler for when the task is deleted.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the ID given to it is invalid

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32 *queue_id, const char *queue_name, uint32 queue_depth, uint32 data_size, uint32 flags)
memberdef.name: OS_QueueCreate

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Create a message queue which can be refered to by name or ID

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if th ename to found is too long to begin with
OS_ERR_NO_FREE_IDS if there are already the max queues created
OS_ERR_NAME_TAKEN if the name is already being used on another queue

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Deletes the specified message queue.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: If There are messages on the queue, they will be lost and any subsequent calls to QueueGet or QueuePut to this queue will result in errors

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the ID given to it is invalid

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32 queue_id, void *data, uint32 size, uint32 *size_copied, int32 timeout)
memberdef.name: OS_QueueGet

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Receive a message on a message queue. Will pend or timeout on the receive.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the given ID does not exist
OS_QUEUE_EMPTY if the Queue has no messages on it to be recieved
OS_QUEUE_TIMEOUT if the timeout was OS_PEND and the time expired
OS_QUEUE_INVALID_SIZE if the size of the buffer passed in is not big enough for the maximum size messaged

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32 queue_id, const void *data, uint32 size, uint32 flags)
memberdef.name: OS_QueuePut

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Put a message on a message queue.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: The flags parameter is not used. The message put is always configured to immediately return an error if the receiving message queue is full.

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the queue id passed in is not a valid queue
OS_QUEUE_FULL if the queue cannot accept another message

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function tries to find a queue Id given the name of the queue. The id of the queue is passed back in queue_id

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if th ename to found is too long to begin with
OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND the name was not found in the table

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function will pass back a pointer to structure that contains all of the relevant info (name and creator) about the specified queue.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: queue_prop OS_queue_prop_t Queue properties struct pointer

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the ID given is not a valid queue

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32 *sem_id, const char *sem_name, uint32 sem_initial_value, uint32 options)
memberdef.name: OS_BinSemCreate

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Creates a binary semaphore with initial value specified by sem_initial_value and name specified by sem_name. sem_id will be returned to the caller

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: options is an unused parameter

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if th ename to found is too long to begin with
OS_ERR_NO_FREE_IDS if there are already the max queues created
OS_ERR_NAME_TAKEN if the name is already being used on another queue
OS_SEM_FAILURE if the OS call failed

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Deletes the specified Binary Semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Since we can't delete a semaphore which is currently locked by some task (as it may ber crucial to completing the task), the semaphore must be full to allow deletion.

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a binary semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The function unlocks the semaphore referenced by sem_id by performing a semaphore unlock operation on that semaphore.If the semaphore value resulting from this operation is positive, then no threads were blocked waiting for the semaphore to become unlocked; the semaphore value is simply incremented for this semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a binary semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The function unblocks all tasks pending on the specified semaphore. However, this function does not change the state of the semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a binary semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The locks the semaphore referenced by sem_id by performing a semaphore lock operation on that semaphore.If the semaphore value is currently zero, then the calling thread shall not return from the call until it either locks the semaphore or the call is interrupted by a signal.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a binary semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The function locks the semaphore referenced by sem_id . However, if the semaphore cannot be locked without waiting for another process or thread to unlock the semaphore , this wait shall be terminated when the specified timeout ,msecs, expires.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_SEM_TIMEOUT if semaphore was not relinquished in time
OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a binary semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

briefdescription.para: Get binary semaphore id by name.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function tries to find a binary sem Id given the name of a bin_sem The id is returned through sem_id

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER is semid or sem_name are NULL pointers
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if the name given is to long to have been stored
OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND if the name was not found in the table

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function will pass back a pointer to structure that contains all of the relevant info( name and creator) about the specified binary semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: bin_prop OS_bin_sem_prop_t Semphore properties struct pointer

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a binary semaphore
OS_INVALID_POINTER if the bin_prop pointer is null

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32 *sem_id, const char *sem_name, uint32 sem_initial_value, uint32 options)
memberdef.name: OS_CountSemCreate

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Creates a counting semaphore with initial value specified by sem_initial_value and name specified by sem_name. sem_id will be returned to the caller

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: options is an unused parameter

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if th ename to found is too long to begin with
OS_ERR_NO_FREE_IDS if there are already the max queues created
OS_ERR_NAME_TAKEN if the name is already being used on another queue
OS_SEM_FAILURE if the OS call failed

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Deletes the specified counting Semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Since we can't delete a semaphore which is currently locked by some task (as it may ber crucial to completing the task), the semaphore must be full to allow deletion.

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a counting semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The function unlocks the semaphore referenced by sem_id by performing a semaphore unlock operation on that semaphore.If the semaphore value resulting from this operation is positive, then no threads were blocked waiting for the semaphore to become unlocked; the semaphore value is simply incremented for this semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a counting semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The locks the semaphore referenced by sem_id by performing a semaphore lock operation on that semaphore.If the semaphore value is currently zero, then the calling thread shall not return from the call until it either locks the semaphore or the call is interrupted by a signal.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a counting semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The function locks the semaphore referenced by sem_id . However, if the semaphore cannot be locked without waiting for another process or thread to unlock the semaphore , this wait shall be terminated when the specified timeout ,msecs, expires.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_SEM_TIMEOUT if semaphore was not relinquished in time
OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a counting semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

briefdescription.para: Get counting semaphore id by name.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function tries to find a counting sem Id given the name of a count_sem The id is returned through sem_id

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER is semid or sem_name are NULL pointers
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if the name given is to long to have been stored
OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND if the name was not found in the table

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function will pass back a pointer to structure that contains all of the relevant info( name and creator) about the specified counting semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: count_prop OS_count_sem_prop_t Semphore properties struct pointer

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a counting semaphore
OS_INVALID_POINTER if the count_prop pointer is null

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Creates a mutex semaphore initially full.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: options is an unused parameter

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if the pointers passed in are NULL
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if th ename to found is too long to begin with
OS_ERR_NO_FREE_IDS if there are already the max queues created
OS_ERR_NAME_TAKEN if the name is already being used on another queue
OS_SEM_FAILURE if the OS call failed

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Deletes the specified mutex Semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: The mutex must be full to take it, so we have to check for fullness

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a mutex semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The function releases the mutex object referenced by sem_id.The manner in which a mutex is released is dependent upon the mutex's type attribute. If there are threads blocked on the mutex object referenced by mutex when this function is called, resulting in the mutex becoming available, the scheduling policy shall determine which thread shall acquire the mutex.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a mutex semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The mutex object referenced by sem_id shall be locked by calling this function. If the mutex is already locked, the calling thread shall block until the mutex becomes available. This operation shall return with the mutex object referenced by mutex in the locked state with the calling thread as its owner.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a mutex semaphore
OS_SEM_FAILURE the semaphore was not previously initialized or is not in the array of semaphores defined by the system

briefdescription.para: Get mutex semaphore id by name.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function tries to find a mutex sem Id given the name of a mut_sem The id is returned through sem_id

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER is semid or sem_name are NULL pointers
OS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG if the name given is to long to have been stored
OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND if the name was not found in the table

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function will pass back a pointer to structure that contains all of the relevant info( name and creator) about the specified mutex semaphore.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: mut_prop OS_mut_sem_prop_t Semphore properties struct pointer

entry.para: OS_ERR_INVALID_ID if the id passed in is not a mutex semaphore
OS_INVALID_POINTER if the mut_prop pointer is null

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function returns the duration of a system tick in micro seconds.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None
duration of a system tick in microseconds

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function accepts a time interval in milliseconds, as an input and returns the tick equivalent for this time period. The tick value is rounded up.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: uint32 the time interval, in milli second, to be translated to ticks

simplesect.para: the number of ticks rounded up.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.para: This functions sets the local time of the machine its on

simplesect.para: None

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if any of the necessary pointers are NULL

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function disables the output to the UART from OS_printf.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function enables the output to the UART through OS_printf.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description

entry.para: OS_INVALID_POINTER if any of the necessary pointers are NULL
